post.summary: Query digital twin graph using cypher query.

parameters.name: Where
parameters.description: (Optional) Cypher query WHERE part. e.g. "stream.ValueMetadataId = '6e02502-bfc5-4182-aa3b-891965020e14'", "stream.MerkleTreeDepth IS NOT NULL", "option:PersistenceOptionsTributechIoV1",...

parameters.name: With
parameters.description: Cypher query WITH part. The result must be projected to lists named "nodes" and "relationships" to be returned which can be done at the WITH part. To return an empty list for one of them you can use "[] AS relationships". e.g. "stream AS nodes, [] AS relationships", "collect(distinct stream) + collect(distinct option) AS nodes, collect(relationship) AS relationships"),...

schema.example: collect(distinct stream) + collect(distinct option) AS nodes, collect(relationship) AS relationships

parameters.example: collect(distinct stream) + collect(distinct option) AS nodes, collect(relationship) AS relationships

post.summary: Query digital twin graph by criterias.

get.summary: Get all outgoing relationships for a digital twin.
Get all incoming relationships for a digital twin.
Get all relationships between digital twins.

post.summary:
Create new relationship between digital twins.
Currently no checks regarding existence of referenced twins is made!

get.summary: Get single relationship between digital twins by relationship id.

put.summary:
Create or update relationship between digital twins.
urrently no checks regarding existence of referenced twins is made!

delete.summary: Delete relationship of digital twins (if exists).

get.summary: Get all digital twins of certain model type.
Get single digital twin by id.

delete.summary: Delete digital twin (if exists) and all its relationsips.
